bitfields.name: BOOT_FAILURE_PIN
bitfields.description:
GPIO port and number of the pin to use for indicating failure reason. 
The toggle rate of the pin is used to decode the error type. [2:0] - Defines GPIO port [7:3] - Defines GPIO pin

bitfields.name: SPI_RECOVERY_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: SPI flash recovery boot is enabled, if non-zero value is written to this field.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_PIN
registers.description:
Device Configuration Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Pinned. 
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level: 
 - PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. 
 - PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. 
 - PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected. 
 - PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and can't be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: UUID_CHECK
bitfields.description: Enforce UUID match during Debug authentication.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_DFLT
registers.description:
Device Configuration Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Debug Filter. 
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level: 
 - PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. 
 - PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. 
 - PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected. 
 - PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and can't be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: NIDEN
bitfields.description: Non Secure non-invasive debug fixed state

bitfields.name: VENDOR_USAGE
bitfields.description: Upper 16 bits of vendor usage field defined in DAP. Lower 16-bits come from customer field area.

bitfields.name: RSA4K
bitfields.description: Select minimal key length. To enforce usage of RSA4096, setting 0b11 value is recommended to allow RSA4096 keys only.

values.name: RSA2048
values.description: RSA2048 or higher can be used for image signing. Only RSA2048 can be used as debug keys.

values.name: RSA4096_0
values.description: Only RSA4096 keys can be used for image signing and debug authentication.

values.name: RSA4096_1
values.description: Only RSA4096 keys can be used for image signing and debug authentication.

values.name: RSA4096_2
values.description: Only RSA4096 keys can be used for image signing and debug authentication.

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_NXP_CFG
bitfields.description: Include NXP area in DICE computation.

bitfields.name: DICE_CUST_CFG
bitfields.description: Include Customer factory area (including keys) in DICE computation.

values.name: HEADER
values.description: TZ-M image mode is taken from application image header

values.name: DISABLED
values.description: TZ-M disabled image, boots to non-secure mode

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: TZ-M enabled image, boots to secure mode

values.name: PRESET
values.description: TZ-M enabled image with TZ-M preset, boot to secure mode TZ-M pre-configured by data from application image header

bitfields.name: BOOT_SEED_INC_NXP_CFG
bitfields.description: Include NXP area in BOOT SEED computation

bitfields.name: BOOT_SEED_CUST_CFG
bitfields.description: Include Customer factory area (including keys) in BOOT SEED computation.

bitfields.name: BOOT_SEED_INC_SEC_EPOCH
bitfields.description: Include security EPOCH in BOOT_SEED computation.

values.name: DISABLE
values.description: Plain image (internal flash with or without CRC)

values.name: ENABLE_0
values.description: Boot signed images. (internal flash, RSA signed)

values.name: ENABLE_1
values.description: Boot signed images. (internal flash, RSA signed)

values.name: ENABLE_2
values.description: Boot signed images. (internal flash, RSA signed)

registers.name: Reserved 0x00018
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00030
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00034
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00038
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x0003C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00040
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00044
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00048
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x0004C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: BLE_UNIQUE_ADDRESS0
registers.description: Bits 31 downto 0 of the BLE Unique Address to be used when BLE_UNIQUE_ADDRESS_VALID field is equal to 0xC3A5

bitfields.name: BLE_UNIQUE_ADDRESS_47_32
bitfields.description: Bits 47 downto 32 of the BLE Unique Address to be used when BLE_UNIQUE_ADDRESS_VALID field is equal to 0xC3A5

bitfields.name: BLE_UNIQUE_ADDRESS_VALID
bitfields.description: Use 48-bit value from BLE_UNIQUE_ADDRESS field as BLE address when this field is equal to 0xC3A5. If this field is different from 0xC3A5, check BLE_DEFAULT_ADDRESS_VALID field in NMPA to know which address to use.

registers.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
registers.description: This 32-bit register contains the size of the image to remap, in bytes.

registers.name: FLASH_REMAP_OFFSET
registers.description: This 32-bit register contains the offset by which the image is to be remapped.

registers.name: ROTKH0
registers.description: ROTKH0 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[255:224]

registers.name: ROTKH1
registers.description: ROTKH1 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[223:192]

registers.name: ROTKH2
registers.description: ROTKH2 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[191:160]

registers.name: ROTKH3
registers.description: ROTKH3 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[159:128]

registers.name: ROTKH4
registers.description: ROTKH4 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[127:96]

registers.name: ROTKH5
registers.description: ROTKH5 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[95:64]

registers.name: ROTKH6
registers.description: ROTKH6 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[63:32]

registers.name: ROTKH7
registers.description: ROTKH7 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[31:0]
